categories.name: The Art of Sushi: From Nigiri to Sashimi

questions.clue: This type of sushi consists of a small ball of rice topped with a slice of fish.
Often served without rice, this type of sushi highlights the fish itself and is commonly dipped in soy sauce.
This green paste, often mistaken for wasabi, is actually a mixture of horseradish, mustard, and food coloring.
Named after a city, this roll contains cucumber, crab stick, and avocado, and is usually wrapped in seaweed.
This method of preparing sushi rice involves using a paddle called shamoji and a wooden tub known as a hangiri.

categories.name: Anime Through the Ages: From Classics to New Releases

questions.clue: This 1988 film, based on Katsuhiro Otomo's manga, is credited with popularizing anime in the West.
This Studio Ghibli film, directed by Hayao Miyazaki, features a young girl who becomes a witch's apprentice in a world of magic.
In this 2006 anime series, a high school student finds a notebook that allows him to kill anyone by writing their name in it.
Set in a post-apocalyptic world, this 2013 anime features humanity battling giant humanoid creatures known as Titans.
This 2021 anime series follows the story of a young boy who dreams of becoming a sushi chef, navigating the challenges of culinary school.

categories.name: World Capitals: Hidden Gems and Fun Facts

questions.clue: For $200: Known for its iconic cherry blossom festivals, this capital is also famous for its sushi restaurants and vibrant anime culture.
For $400: This European capital is home to Tivoli Gardens, one of the world's oldest amusement parks, and is famous for its Little Mermaid statue.
For $600: Known as the City of Music, this capital boasts the world-famous Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra.
For $800: This South American capital is famous for its La Boca neighborhood, known for tango dancing and colorful buildings.
For $1000: This African capital is known for its unique Souks and the historic medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, bustling with life and culture.

categories.name: Innovations in Technology: Pioneers and Breakthroughs

questions.clue: For $200: This tech giant co-founded Apple, a company known for its innovative products like the iPhone.
For $400: He is often credited as the father of the World Wide Web, launching the first website in 1991.
For $600: This Japanese company revolutionized both gaming and anime culture with the release of the Game Boy and Pokémon.
For $800: Known for their sushi-like assembly line, this company's Just-In-Time production system transformed manufacturing efficiency.
For $1000: This computer scientist invented the first high-level programming language, Fortran, in 1957.

categories.name: Mythical Creatures: Legends from Around the World

questions.clue: In Japanese folklore, this creature is a turtle-like water spirit known to love cucumbers and sumo wrestling.
This creature from Greek mythology, part lion, part goat, and part serpent, breathes fire and shares its name with a genetic organism in 'Fullmetal Alchemist'.
In Celtic folklore, this mischievous fairy is known for leading travelers astray with its light.
This legendary creature from Scandinavian folklore is known for its immense size and is often portrayed as a sea serpent that can encircle the earth.
In Hindu mythology, this divine bird is known as the king of birds and serves as the mount of the god Vishnu.

final.clue: This Japanese word, commonly associated with sushi, refers to the way artists and animators can convey emotions and atmosphere in anime, often using specific visual cues.
